sentences.sContent: Your car was stolen at the police station! How ironic!
sentences.sCn: 你的车在警察局被偷！真让人哭笑不得！

sentences.sContent: It’s ironic that her husband smoked for thirty years, and yet she’s the one who died of lung cancer.
sentences.sCn: 具有讽刺意味的是，她丈夫吸烟30年，而死于肺癌的却是她。

sentences.sContent: In an ironic twist , the most trustworthy character in the film turned out to be the thief.
sentences.sCn: 影片中故事情节来了一个出乎意料的转折，最可信赖的人原来是小偷。

words.tran: 讽刺；反语；具有讽刺意味的事

trans.tranOther: an ironic situation is one that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true
